breakpoints.description: Configured tracing breakpoints for the run. Each BreakPoint can contain nested thenPoints (recursive) to represent conditional sub-traces that should only be captured when the parent BreakPoint was matched and its ifConditionExpression evaluated to true.

tracings.description: Collected runtime tracing records for the run. Entries can be nested via thenTracings to reflect the runtime nesting caused by matching a BreakPoint with thenPoints.

spelExpression.description: Spring Expression Language (SpEL) expression. The evaluation context uses: root object = 'this' (the intercepted instance); variables: method parameters by name; 'return' is available for AFTER expressions (method result); 'throw' is available for ON_ERROR expressions (exception). The evaluated value is serialized using the configured Options (container size limits, object field representation, and max depth).

representation.description: Object field extraction mode used when building a JSON-safe representation of an object. PUBLIC_FIELDS: only public fields; DECLARED_FIELDS: all declared fields; DECLARED_FIELDS_WITH_GETTERS: declared fields plus getter-derived values (if supported by the adapter).

sizeLimitPerContainerClass.description: Container/array size limiting rules used when rendering values. Key: fully-qualified Java class name of the container type (e.g. java.util.List, java.util.Map). Value semantics: if a class key is absent, the adapter defaults to limiting that container class to 10 elements/entries; if present and value < 0, traversal stops for that container (it is not expanded); if present and value >= 0, expansion is limited to that many elements/entries.

objectRepresentationPerClass.description: Overrides for how specific object types are represented. Key: fully-qualified Java class name. Value: representation mode. If null or empty, the adapter uses its default object rendering strategy.

maxDepthLimit.description: Maximum traversal depth for object graphs when converting values to a JSON-safe representation. Once the depth limit is reached, nested values are truncated/stopped to avoid runaway recursion and excessive output.

className.description: Fully-qualified class name where the breakpoint applies.

lineOfCode.description: Line number in the source file. Matching is tolerant (within Â±1 line) to account for source/bytecode line mapping differences.

watchExpressionsBefore.description: SpEL expressions evaluated before the method proceeds.

watchExpressionsAfter.description: SpEL expressions evaluated after the method returns successfully. Variable 'return' is available.

watchExpressionsOnError.description: SpEL expressions evaluated when the method throws. Variable 'throw' is available.

ifConditionExpression.description: Optional SpEL boolean expression used to decide whether this breakpoint's tracing flow is active. If null/blank, the breakpoint always passes. If evaluation fails, it is treated as false.

thenPoints.description: Recursive nested breakpoints. When this BreakPoint matches and passes ifConditionExpression, thenPoints become eligible for matching during the lifetime of the current scope, allowing nested (then) tracing trees.

options.description: Rendering options used when serializing watched values for this breakpoint.

phase.description: Tracing record phase. CALL indicates a normal call tracing record; ERROR indicates an error-path record.

point.description: Tracing point identifier (typically the class name).

ifCondition.description: Whether the breakpoint's ifConditionExpression evaluated to true for this record (i.e., whether the tracing flow was active).

watchesBefore.description: Map from watch expression string to its rendered value (or evaluation error message).

watchesAfter.description: Map from watch expression string to its rendered value (or evaluation error message).

watchesOnError.description: Map from watch expression string to its rendered value (or evaluation error message).

stackTrace.description: Stack trace captured when an exception is thrown (null if no exception).

errorMessage.description: Exception message captured when an exception is thrown (null if no exception).

timestampMs.description: Record timestamp in milliseconds since epoch.

durationMs.description: Duration of the intercepted call in milliseconds.

thenTracings.description: Nested tracing records produced by matching thenPoints within the open scope created by this breakpoint.
